metadata.title: CVE-2019-12436 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Samba 4.10.x before 4.10.5 has a NULL pointer dereference, leading to an ADDC LDAP server Denial of Service. This is related to an attacker using thepaged search control. The attacker must have directory read access in orderto attempt an exploit.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.21').
